rect.onmousemove: ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol***RFC: 2821***Draft name: draft-ietf-drums-smtpupd***Abstract: This document is a self-contained specification of the basic protocol for the Internet electronic mail transport. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Detailed Revision/Update of Message Standards***Area: Applications Area***Creation: 11/08/1995***Publish: 04/01/2001")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Goals for Internet Messaging to Support Diverse Service Environments***RFC: 4416***Draft name: draft-ietf-lemonade-goals***Abstract: This document is a history capturing the background, motivation and thinking during the LEMONADE definition and design process.***Group: Enhancements to Internet email to Support Diverse Service Environments***Area: Applications Area***Creation: 06/24/2003***Publish: 02/28/2006")

svg.text: Goals for Internet Messaging to Support Diverse Service Environments

rect.onmousemove: ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Internet Message Access Protocol - Version 4***RFC: 1730***Draft name: draft-ietf-imap-imap4***Abstract: The Internet Message Access Protocol, Version 4 (IMAP4) allows a client to access and manipulate electronic mail messages on a server. IMAP4 permits manipulation of remote message folders, called 'mailboxes', in a way that is functionally equivalent to local mailboxes. IMAP4 also provides the capability for an offline client to resynchronize with the server. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Internet Message Access Protocol***Area: Applications Area***Creation: 08/11/1994***Publish: 12/01/1994")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: POP3 AUTHentication command***RFC: 1734***Draft name: draft-myers-pop3-auth***Abstract: This document describes the optional AUTH command, for indicating an authentication mechanism to the server, performing an authentication protocol exchange, and optionally negotiating a protection mechanism for subsequent protocol interactions. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 08/02/1994***Publish: 12/01/1994")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: POP3 Extension Mechanism***RFC: 2449***Draft name: draft-gellens-pop3ext***Abstract: This memo updates RFC 1939 to define a mechanism to announce support for optional commands, extensions, and unconditional server behavior. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 02/13/1998***Publish: 11/01/1998")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: POP3 Support for UTF-8***RFC: None***Draft name: draft-newman-ima-pop***Abstract: This specification extends the Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3) to support unencoded international characters in user names, mail addresses and message headers. This is an early draft and intended as a framework for discussion. Please do not deploy implementations of this draft.***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 02/28/2006***Publish: None")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Post Office Protocol - Version 3***RFC: 1725***Draft name: draft-rose-pop3-again***Abstract: This memo is a revision to RFC 1460, a Draft Standard. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 07/11/1994***Publish: 11/01/1994")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Post Office Protocol - Version 3***RFC: 1725***Draft name: draft-rose-pop3-again***Abstract: This memo is a revision to RFC 1460, a Draft Standard. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 07/11/1994***Publish: 11/01/1994")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Post Office Protocol - Version 3***RFC: 1460***Draft name: draft-rose-pop3***Abstract: This memo is a revision to RFC 1225, a Draft Standard. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 04/16/1993***Publish: 06/01/1993")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Post Office Protocol - Version 3***RFC: 1939***Draft name: draft-myers-pop-pop3***Abstract: The Post Office Protocol - Version 3 (POP3) is intended to permit a workstation to dynamically access a maildrop on a server host in a useful fashion. [STANDARDS-TRACK]***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 05/15/1995***Publish: 05/01/1996")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: STANDARD FOR THE FORMAT OF ARPA INTERNET TEXT MESSAGES***RFC: 822***Draft name: rfc822***Abstract: This document revises the specifications in RFC 733, in order to serve the needs of the larger and more complex ARPA Internet. Some of RFC 733's features failed to gain adequate acceptance. In order to simplify the standard and the software that follows it, these features have been removed. A different addressing scheme is used, to handle the case of internetwork mail; and the concept of re-transmission has been introduced. Obsoletes RFC 733, NIC 41952.***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 08/01/1982***Publish: 08/01/1982")

svg.text: STANDARD FOR THE FORMAT OF ARPA INTERNET TEXT MESSAGES

rect.onmousemove: ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol***RFC: 821***Draft name: rfc821***Abstract: The objective of Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is to transfer mail reliably and efficiently. SMTP is independent of the particular transmission subsystem and requires only a reliable ordered data stream channel. Obsoletes RFC 788, 780, and 772.***Group: Individual Submissions***Area: General Area***Creation: 08/01/1982***Publish: 08/01/1982")

ShowTooltip(evt, "Title: The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm***RFC: 1321***Draft name: draft-rsadsi-rivest-md5***Abstract: This document describes the MD5 message-digest algorithm. The algorithm takes as input a message of arbitrary length and produces as output a 128-bit 'fingerprint' or 'message digest' of the input. This memo provides information for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard.***Group: Privacy-Enhanced Electronic Mail***Area: Security Area***Creation: 04/03/1992***Publish: 04/01/1992")
